metadata.name: New Custom Shim Database Created
metadata.comment: Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims. The Microsoft Windows Application Compatibility Infrastructure/Framework (Application Shim) was created to allow for backward compatibility of software as the operating system codebase changes over time.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (contains(lower(file.path), lower(':\\windows\\apppatch\\custom\\')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower(':\\windows\\apppatch\\customsdb\\'))))

output.summary: Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims. The Microsoft Windows Application Compatibility Infrastructure/Framework (Application Shim) was created to allow for backward compatibility of software as the operating system codebase changes over time.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate custom SHIM installations will also trigger this rule References: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1546.011/T1546.011.md#atomic-test-2---new-shim-database-files-created-in-the-default-shim-database-directory, https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/fin7-shim-databases-persistence, https://liberty-shell.com/sec/2020/02/25/shim-persistence/, https://andreafortuna.org/2018/11/12/process-injection-and-persistence-using-application-shimming/
